content: https://www.forbes.com/sites/digital-assets/2024/12/14/trump-confirms-bitcoin-reserve-plans-15-trillion-price-boom-predicted/This may be the biggest news of all for the Bitcoin market. US President Donald Trump has adopted Bitcoin because before Donald Trump won the election, the price of Bitcoin started to increase at a rocket speed and still the price of Bitcoin continues to increase. The Bitcoin Reserve Plan that he has now confirmed is positive for the Bitcoin market and will be bullish for Bitcoin.  Trump told CNBC in an interview that they are going to do great things with crypto because they don't want China or anyone else. Maybe that's why they confirmed the Bitcoin reserve plan.Trump told CNBC in an interview:

comments.body: Everyone want to take their chance in Bitcoin and even the United States is not exceptional to that, as there have been warning of dollar collapse in the future, the government will definitely look into alternatives and Bitcoin at this point is the smartest alternative we can point to at this moment, we have to figure out what the extent of Bitcoin adoptions by the coming government and how he intend to approach a decetlntalised system with centralized government.What I noticed is that, the president elect is more kind in the area of investment and reserves using Bitcoin and also building infrastructure for Bitcoin related activities such as mining thinking having the biggest mining ring in the US could influence how the country interfere with Bitcoin transactions and value even though this last point is impossible using (POW).

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Well, if this happens; I'm sure that a host of other 1st world countries would follow suit including Germany only that they'd be buying back at much higher price than they sold.Bitcoin reserves is a smart move for the government but there's a two-way effect of this move on bitcoin.1. Price go up.2. Decentralization goes lower.We might be looking at a potential tug of war among countries for very limited amount of Bitcoin since some of them are lost.Amazing time to be alive. I was here when governments fought bitcoin as hard as they good. Feels really good to see them lose that fight.As Putin puts it: "Who can stop Bitcoin? No one.".

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: They haven’t disclosed how much they’re considering, but that’s not the most relevant part. The bigger news here is that treating Bitcoin as a reserve asset would send a strong message to the world that Bitcoin is legitimate.And you know what happens next - it would drive more institutional investors to enter the market. Who knows, even companies like Microsoft, which previously stated they wouldn’t invest in Bitcoin, might change their stance once Trump’s plan is realized.
